alert.note: Alert for Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 4:11PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Sussex and northern Warren Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Alpine Mountain to Echo Lake to near East Bangor. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Blairstown, Branchville, Flatbrookville, Five Points, Columbia, Crandon Lakes, Greendell, Millbrook, Hainesville and Portland. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 5 and 13, and near mile marker 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northwestern New Jersey...and eastern and northeastern Pennsylvania.
